00011 #include <wx/defs.h>
00012 #include <wx/colour.h>
00013 #include "Theme.h"
00014 
00015 class wxImage;
00016 
00017 // This looks at the first pixel in the image, and shifts
00018 // the entire image by the vector difference between that 
00019 // pixel and the dstColour.  For better control, use
00020 // ChangeImageColour(wxImage, wxColour*, wxColour*) below
00021 wxImage *ChangeImageColour(wxImage * srcImage, wxColour & dstColour); 
00022 
00023 // This function takes a source image, which it assumes to
00024 // be grayscale, and smoothly changes the overall color
00025 // to the specified color, and returns the result as a
00026 // new image.  This works well for grayscale 3D images.
00027 // Audacity uses this routines to make the buttons
00028 // (skip-start, play, stop, record, skip-end) adapt to
00029 // the color scheme of the user.
00030 wxImage *ChangeImageColour(wxImage * srcImage,
00031                            wxColour & srcColour,
00032                            wxColour & dstColour);
00033      
00034 // Takes a background image, foreground image, and mask
00035 // (i.e. the alpha channel for the foreground), and
00036 // returns an new image where the foreground has been
00037 // overlaid onto the background using alpha-blending,
00038 // at location (xoff, yoff).
00039 wxImage *OverlayImage(wxImage * background, wxImage * foreground,
00040                       wxImage * mask, int xoff, int yoff);
00041 
00042 
00043 // Same idea, but this time the mask is an alpha channel in
00044 // the foreground bitmap, and it's all retrieved from Themes.
00045 wxImage *OverlayImage(teBmps eBack, teBmps eForeground,
00046                       int xoff, int yoff);
00047 
00048 
00049 // Creates an image with a solid background color
00050 wxImage *CreateBackground(int width, int height, wxColour colour);
00051 
00052 // Creates an image with the Mac OS X Aqua stripes, to be used
00053 // as a background
00054 wxImage *CreateAquaBackground(int width, int height, int offset);
00055 
00056 // Uses color on all OS except Mac, uses Aqua
00057 wxImage *CreateSysBackground(int width, int height, int offset,
00058                              wxColour colour);
00059 
00060 // Pastes one image into another at specified location.
00061 void PasteSubImage( wxImage * pDest, wxImage * pSrc, int x, int y );
00062 
00063 // Gets a rectangle from within anothe rimage, INCLUDING the alpha channel
00064 wxImage GetSubImageWithAlpha( const wxImage & Src,  const wxRect &rect );
